schema.description: IP Address/IP Range/IP Segment
Email address Ticket credential, part of the string in the verification email's URL.
The name of the template that has been created and approved in advance.
The sending address configured in the management console.

The name of the recipient list that has been created and uploaded with recipients. Note: The recipient list should not be deleted until at least 10 minutes after the task is triggered, otherwise it may cause sending failure.

- 0: Random account
- 1: Sending address
Email tag name.
Reply address
Alias for the reply address

- 1: Enable data tracking function
- 0 (default): Disable data tracking function

The type of generated unsubscribe link. Refer to the [Unsubscribe Function Link Generation and Filtering Mechanism](~~2689048~~) document.
- disabled: Do not generate
- default: Use the default strategy: Generate an unsubscribe link when a bulk-type sending address sends to specific domains, such as those containing keywords like "gmail", "yahoo",
"google", "aol.com", "hotmail",
"outlook", "ymail.com", etc.
- zh-cn: Generate, for future content preparation
- en-us: Generate, for future content preparation

Filtering level. Refer to the [Unsubscribe Function Link Generation and Filtering Mechanism](~~2689048~~) document.
- disabled: No filtering
- default: Use the default strategy, bulk addresses use sender address-level filtering
- mailfrom: Sender address-level filtering
- mailfrom_domain: Sender domain-level filtering
- edm_id: Account-level filtering

Currently, the standard fields that can be added to the email header are Message-ID, List-Unsubscribe, and List-Unsubscribe-Post. Standard fields will overwrite the existing values in the email header, while non-standard fields must start with X-User- and will be appended to the email header. Currently, up to 10 headers can be passed in JSON format, and both standard and non-standard fields must comply with the syntax requirements for headers.
dedicated IP pool ID. Users who have purchased an dedicated IP can use this parameter to specify the outgoing IP for this send operation.

schema.description: Response
Domain name, length 1-50, can include numbers, uppercase letters, lowercase letters, ., and -.

The selector field in the DKIM protocol, used to identify a specific public key. It is recommended to leave it blank, as the system will automatically generate it based on cluster information. If the user specifies it manually, for example, if the sending domain is "sub.example.com" and dkimSelector is set to "default", then the host record will be "default._domainkey.sub"
Constraints: 
1. The length must not exceed 60 characters. 
2. It must consist of visible characters only. 
3. It cannot start with a hyphen (-). 
4. It cannot end with a hyphen (-). 
5. It cannot contain any of the following characters: _ :;/!*~.@#$%^&()+=[{]}|?<>,'"
Sender's email address
Reply-to address

Type of sending. Values:

- batch: Bulk emails

- trigger: Triggered emails

Data.description: A list of unsubscriptions or reports.

SendTime.description: The time when the email was sent.

BlockTime.description: The time when the email address was blocked.

Reason.description:
The reason for the block. The value is a bitset. The meaning of each bit is as follows:

- 0: The reason is not specified.

- 1: Not interested in the content.

- 2: Repetitive content.

- 3: Content is sent too frequently.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of entries returned.

schema.description: The ID of the recipient list.

The details of the recipients. You can upload up to 500 recipients at a time. Enclose each recipient's details in braces \`{}\` and separate them with commas. Example: \`\[{ },{ },{ }...]\`.

The format for the details is \`\[{"b":"birthday","e":"xxx\@example.net","g":"gender","m":"mobile","n":"nickname","u":"name"}]\`. Pass this value as a string, not an array.

If you add a duplicate recipient address, the system returns \`"ErrorCount": 1\`.

If you insert a duplicate recipient address, it will return "ErrorCount": 1.
The recipient's email address and template parameters. This must be in an array format.

SuccessCount.description: The number of recipients that were successfully added.

Detail.description: A list of recipient addresses that failed to be added.

schema.description: Template ID
Sender address, with a maximum length of 60 characters
UserName, with a maximum length of 30 characters
NickName, with a maximum length of 30 characters
Birthday, with a maximum length of 30 characters
Gender, with a maximum length of 30 characters
Mobile, with a maximum length of 30 characters
Recipient address, with a maximum length of 60 characters
Detailed information

SendValidateFile.summary: Uploads a file of addresses for validation.

schema.description: The URL of the address list.
The file name of the address list.
The column that contains email addresses in the file. The index starts from 1.
Specifies whether the first row is a table header.
Specifies whether to remove duplicate email addresses from the output file.

FileId.description: The file ID. Use this ID to query the result.

schema.description: The schema of the response.

SendValidateFile.title: SendValidateFile

SenderStatisticsByTagNameAndBatchID.summary: Retrieve the send data under specified conditions.

schema.description: Sender address. If not specified, it represents all addresses.
Start time. The time cannot be earlier than 30 days ago. Format: yyyy-MM-dd.
End time. The span between the end time and the start time must not exceed 7 days. Format: yyyy-MM-dd.
Email tag. If not specified, it represents all tags.
For dedicated IP users, query data for a specific dedicated IP pool ID.  \nIf this parameter is not specified, all data is queried by default.
For dedicated IP users, query data for a specific dedicated IP.  \nIf this parameter is not specified, all data is queried by default.

For dedicated IP users, query data for a specific ESP. The following values can be specified:  
- gmail.com  
- yahoo.com  
- outlook.com  
- icloud.com  
- others (corresponds to data from ESPs other than those listed above)  

If this parameter is not specified, all data is queried by default.

SenderStatisticsByTagNameAndBatchID.title: Retrieve the send data under specified conditions.

SenderStatisticsDetailByParam.summary: Queries the details of sent emails.

schema.description:
The sender address. If you leave this parameter empty, all sender addresses are queried.

> You can leave **AccountName**, **TagName**, and **ToAddress** empty. If you specify a value, you can pass only one of these parameters. You cannot pass a combination of two or more.
The recipient address. If you leave this parameter empty, all recipient addresses are queried.

The delivery result. If you leave this parameter empty, all statuses are queried. Valid values:

- 0: Success

- 2: Invalid address

- 3: Spam

- 4: Failed
The start time. The time span between the start and end time cannot exceed 30 days. The format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm.
The end time. The time span between the start and end time cannot exceed 30 days. The format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm.

The email tag. If you leave this parameter empty, all tags are queried.
When you send an email using SMTP, see the email tracking example to specify the \`TagName\` field and its value for the \`X-AliDM-Trace\` field.
The number of results to return for the current request. The value can be an integer from 1 to 100.
The token for paging. Set this parameter to the \`NextStart\` value returned from a previous call to get the next page of results.
The ID of the dedicated IP address pool.
The ID of the configuration set.

NextStart.description: The token for the next page of results. If this parameter is returned, it means more results are available. Use this token in your next request to get the next page.

Status.description: The delivery status. \`0\`: Success. \`2\`: Invalid address. \`3\`: Spam. \`4\`: Other failures.

LastUpdateTime.description: The time when the record was last updated.

UtcLastUpdateTime.description: The time when the record was last updated, in UTC format.

ErrorClassification.description:
The detailed classification of the error:

- SendOk: The email was delivered.

- SmtpNxBox: The recipient's email system identified the address as invalid. The address is added to your account-level invalid address list.

- SysOutRcptOnAccountLevelBounceList: The address hit the account-level invalid address list. If you confirm that the address is valid, you can remove it on the Invalid Addresses page or choose to disable the account-level invalid address list.

For more information about error descriptions, see [Explanations of common failed\_type values](~~52048~~).

IpPoolId.description: The ID of the dedicated IP address pool.

IpPoolName.description: The name of the dedicated IP address pool.

ConfigSetId.description: The ID of the configuration set.

ConfigSetName.description: The name of the configuration set.

SenderStatisticsDetailByParam.title: Get Sending Details

schema.description: The sender address configured in the console.

The address type. Valid values:

0: Random account

1: Sender address

The tag created in the Direct Mail console. It is used to classify email batches. You can use tags to query the sending status of each batch. If you enable email tracking, you must use an email tag for sending. The tag must be 1 to 128 characters in length and can contain letters, digits, underscores (\_), and hyphens (-).
Specifies whether to use the reply-to address that is configured and verified in the console. Valid values are the strings 'true' and 'false'.
The destination address. You can specify multiple email addresses separated by commas. A maximum of 100 addresses are supported. Address lists are also supported.
The email subject. The subject can be up to 256 characters long.

The HTML body of the email.

Note: HtmlBody and TextBody are for different types of email content. You must specify one of them.

- The size limit is about 80 KB if you pass the parameter in a URL.

- The size limit is about 6 MB if you pass the parameter in the body.

The text body of the email.

Note: HtmlBody and TextBody are for different types of email content. You must specify one of them.

- The size limit is about 80 KB if you pass the parameter in a URL.

- The size limit is about 6 MB if you pass the parameter in the body.

The sender's nickname. The nickname must be less than 15 characters long.

For example, if you set the nickname to 'Xiao Hong' and the sender address is test\*\*\*@example.net, the recipient sees the sender as 'Xiao Hong' \<test\*\*\*@example.net>.
The reply-to address.
The nickname for the reply-to address.

1: Enables data tracking.

0 (default): Disables data tracking.

default: Uses the default policy. An unsubscribe link is generated when sending emails from a batch-type sender address to specific domains, such as those containing keywords like "gmail", "yahoo", "google", "aol.com", "hotmail", "outlook", or "ymail.com". For more information, see [Unsubscribe link generation and filtering mechanism](~~2689048~~).

zh-cn: Generates a link for future content instrumentation.

en-us: Generates a link for future content instrumentation.

Generated to prepare for future content instrumentation.

Generate to prepare for future content instrumentation.

The filtering level. For more information, see [Unsubscribe link generation and filtering mechanism](~~2689048~~).

disabled: No filtering.

default: Uses the default policy. Batch addresses are filtered at the sender address level.

mailfrom: Filters at the sender address level.

mailfrom\_domain: Filters at the email domain level.

edm\_id: Filters at the account level.

The standard fields that you can add to the message header are Message-ID, List-Unsubscribe, and List-Unsubscribe-Post. Standard fields overwrite existing values in the message header. Non-standard fields must start with X-User- and are appended to the message header. You can pass up to 10 message headers in JSON format. Both standard and non-standard fields must comply with the standard header syntax.

The ID of the dedicated IP address pool. If you have purchased dedicated IP addresses, you can use this parameter to specify the outbound IP address for this email. For more information, see [Dedicated IPs](~~2932088~~).

This feature is only available if you download and use the latest software development kit (SDK). It is not supported for OpenAPI calls or signature-based authentication. For more information, see [How do I send an email with attachments using an SDK?](~~2937843~~).

items.description: This feature is only available if you use the latest SDK. It is not supported for OpenAPI calls or signature-based authentication.

AttachmentName.description: This feature is only available if you use the latest SDK. It is not supported for OpenAPI calls or signature-based authentication.

AttachmentUrl.description: This feature is only available if you use the latest SDK. It is not supported for OpenAPI calls or signature-based authentication.

- UNSUB: Unsubscribe

- REPORT: Complaint

UnblockSending.title: Lift Sending Restrictions

schema.description: IP protection switch, On: 1 Off: 0

UpdateIpProtection.title: Enable or Disable IP Protection Function

schema.description: User Information

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: Schema of Response
The email address to validate.
The timeout period. The default value is 60 seconds.
Specifies whether to check the graylist. The default value is false. The result is returned through an asynchronous notification message from EventBridge.

Status.description: The status of the validated email address.

enumValueTitles.CATCHALL: The address is a catch-all address. This indicates that the domain accepts emails sent to any non-existent mailbox in the domain.
enumValueTitles.DONOTMAIL: The address is abnormal and can be excluded from marketing scenarios.

SubStatus.description: The sub-status of the validated email address. This parameter provides a detailed description of the status.

enumValueTitles.NO_DNS_ENTRIES: The address is invalid. No DNS records are found.
enumValueTitles.MISSPELLED: The address is invalid because of a spelling error.
enumValueTitles.MAILBOX_NOT_EXISTS: The address is invalid. The mailbox does not exist.
enumValueTitles.SYSTEM_ERROR: The status is unknown because of a system error.
enumValueTitles.SYNTAX_INVALID: The address is invalid because of a syntax error.
enumValueTitles.ROLE_ACCOUNT: The address is abnormal. It is a role-based account.
enumValueTitles.SMTP_CONNECT_FAILED: The status is unknown. The connection to the recipient's SMTP server failed.
enumValueTitles.DISABLED: The address is invalid. The mailbox is disabled.
enumValueTitles.UNSPECIFIED: No specific sub-status. This may be returned for the VALID, CATCHALL, or UNKNOWN status.
enumValueTitles.IP_UNROUTABLE: The address is invalid. The mail server IP address is unreachable.
enumValueTitles.MAILBOX_FULL: The address is invalid. The mailbox is full.
enumValueTitles.DISPOSABLE: The address is abnormal. It is a disposable email address.
enumValueTitles.TIMEOUT_EXCEEDED: The status is unknown. The specified timeout period was exceeded.

Provider.description: The category of the email service provider for the address.

IsFreeMail.description: Indicates whether the address is from a free email service.

enumValueTitles.true: The address is from a free email service.
enumValueTitles.false: The address is not from a free email service.

LocalPart.description: The local part of the email address that is obtained from syntax parsing. The local part is converted to lowercase, and the part after the plus sign (+) is removed.

DomainPart.description: The domain part of the email address that is obtained from syntax parsing. The domain part is converted to lowercase.
